intro: Bredia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bredia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other hardwood trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, often climbing habit and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Bredia stenophylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
